sentence.Network_en: They're just a bunch of leeches cadging off others!
sentence.Network_cn: 他们只不过是一帮伸手向人要这要那的寄生虫！

sentence.Network_en: Broussais was the first physician to use leeches as a cure-all.
sentence.Network_cn: 布鲁赛是第一个把水蛭当成万灵药的医生。

sentence.Network_en: The usurers are leeches; they have drained us dry.
sentence.Network_cn: 高利贷者是吸血鬼, 他们吸干了我们的血汗.

entry.def: A leech is a small animal which looks like a worm and lives in water. Leeches feed by attaching themselves to other animals and sucking their blood.
If you describe someone as a leech, you disapprove of them because they deliberately depend on other people, often making money out of them.

example.ex: They're just a bunch of leeches cadging off others!
example.tran: 他们只不过是一帮伸手向人要这要那的寄生虫！

auth_sentence.content: Medicinal leeches are perfectly harmless - they just snack and go.
auth_sentence.res_content: Medicinal leeches are perfectly harmless - they just snack and go.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Medicinal leeches are perfectly harmless - they just snack and go.

auth_sentence.content: My eyes were like blood-sucking leeches, fastened to her chest.
